intro: Euacer polycarpon, commonly known as the many-seeded euacer, is a herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by distinctive, elongated pods containing numerous seeds. Its botanical classification places it within the family Polygonaceae, known for its characteristic swollen nodes. Euacer polycarpon is often found in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and in woodland edges.
